meanings.definition: Of or relating to equal angles.
meanings.sent1: The two identical triangles had isoclinic sides.
meanings.sent2: The isoclinic nature of the shapes made them easy to compare.
meanings.sent3: The isoclinic corners of the square made it look perfectly symmetrical.
meanings.sent4: Her isoclinic approach to problem-solving always led to balanced solutions.
meanings.sent5: The isoclinic lines on the graph showed where the angles were equal.

meanings.definition: A line connecting points of equal magnetic inclination.
meanings.sent1: The scientist drew an isoclinic on the map to mark the areas of equal magnetic inclination.
meanings.sent2: The compass needle pointed along the isoclinic towards the north pole.
meanings.sent3: The pirates followed the isoclinic on the map, hoping it would lead them to buried treasure.
meanings.sent4: The isoclinic acted like a guide, showing the sailors the way through the magnetic field.
meanings.sent5: The isoclinic on the map was a crucial navigation tool for the explorers.

meanings.definition: A line connecting points of equal dip.
meanings.sent1: The geologist used an isoclinic to mark the locations with the same dip angle.
meanings.sent2: The isoclinic on the rock formation indicated a consistent dip towards the east.
meanings.sent3: The isoclinic on the map looked like a wavy line connecting points of equal dip.
meanings.sent4: The isoclinic served as a boundary between areas with different dip angles.
meanings.sent5: The isoclinic helped the miners identify where the rock layers had the same dip.
